page.title: 07Butcroft - Darlaston.
page.content: { Walsall Road}is the most important road serving Darlaston. All Saints Church, originally given by the Mills family (ironmasters) in 1872 was destroyed by bombing in 1942, no one was killed but only a crater remained. The{war damage commision}gave Â£28,320 and the parish Â£10,000 - the present church was opened in 1942. The vicar spends half his time as an industrial chaplain and the{council of churches} is much concerned with levels of unemployment -{21,000 worked in the} {mid 70's now only 2,500.}The Methodist Church (1807) is very active in the area. With factory closures more open spaces are appearing to add to the pleasant cemetery in Fallings Heath; Kings Hill Park, and the large group of allotments near the Black Horse. There is now a distinctive Asian style to the shops off Walsall Road
